## TFLB vs RAPI

TFLB vs RAPI: A Comparative Study Harmonizing questionnaire items can be tedious, time-consuming, and highly subjective. For instance, simply drawing a comparison between the Timeline-Followback Interview (TFLB) and the Rutgers Alcohol Problem Index (RAPI) can be a daunting task. But, with the help of Harmony, the process of harmonisation becomes systematic and accurate. This state-of-the-art software solution allows psychologists to compare and match items in these instruments, making 'TFLB vs RAPI' a process that's no longer cumbersome, but engaging and insightful. The power of Harmony comes into play when comparing items across the TFLB and RAPI. The software uses large generative AI models, which can effortlessly calculate a percentage match between each item on both lists. This advanced feature makes the process of conducting a 'TFLB vs RAPI' study a breeze. The Harmony software is designed to facilitate comparisons in multiple languages, catering for researchers globally. As a psychology or social science professional, consider using Harmony for your 'TFLB vs RAPI' comparative study. In addition to selecting instruments from an extensive database, Harmony also lets you upload your instruments in a PDF format. This makes Harmony a highly versatile tool for your research work, enabling you to achieve excellent results in your 'TFLB vs RAPI' comparison, thereby enhancing your research quality and reducing time spent on manual matching. To start using Harmony, all you have to do is visit https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app and enhance your research efficiency immeasurably.

## Compare the items in TFLB and RAPI

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import TFLB and RAPI into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just TFLB into Harmony</a> - compare TFLB with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just RAPI into Harmony</a> - compare RAPI with other instruments
